PyFoam.Applications.PyFoamApplication module¶

Base class for pyFoam-applications

Classes can also be called with a command-line string

class PyFoam.Applications.PyFoamApplication.PyFoamApplication(args=None, description=None, epilog=None, examples=None, usage=None, interspersed=False, nr=None, changeVersion=True, exactNr=True, subcommands=None, inputApp=None, localConfigurationFile=None, findLocalConfigurationFile=None, **kwArgs)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class is the base for all pyFoam-utilities

__dict__ = mappingproxy({'depreciationWarning': <function PyFoamApplication.depreciationWarning>, 'errorPrint': <function PyFoamApplication.errorPrint>, 'silent': <function PyFoamApplication.silent>, 'error': <function PyFoamApplication.error>, '__module__': 'PyFoam.Applications.PyFoamApplication', 'ensureGeneralOptions': <function PyFoamApplication.ensureGeneralOptions>, 'setData': <function PyFoamApplication.setData>, 'iDict': <class 'PyFoam.Applications.PyFoamApplication.PyFoamApplication.iDict'>, '__init__': <function PyFoamApplication.__init__>, '__weakref__': <attribute '__weakref__' of 'PyFoamApplication' objects>, 'localConfigInArgs': <function PyFoamApplication.localConfigInArgs>, 'iterkeys': <function PyFoamApplication.iterkeys>, 'addToCaseLog': <function PyFoamApplication.addToCaseLog>, 'run': <function PyFoamApplication.run>, 'localConfigFromCasename': <function PyFoamApplication.localConfigFromCasename>, '__doc__': 'This class is the base for all pyFoam-utilities', '__dict__': <attribute '__dict__' of 'PyFoamApplication' objects>, 'warning': <function PyFoamApplication.warning>, 'localConfigInArgsFile': <function PyFoamApplication.localConfigInArgsFile>, 'localConfigInCWD': <function PyFoamApplication.localConfigInCWD>, 'iteritems': <function PyFoamApplication.iteritems>, 'checkCase': <function PyFoamApplication.checkCase>, 'getData': <function PyFoamApplication.getData>, '__getattr__': <function PyFoamApplication.__getattr__>, '__setitem__': <function PyFoamApplication.__setitem__>, '__iter__': <function PyFoamApplication.__iter__>, 'addOptions': <function PyFoamApplication.addOptions>, '__getitem__': <function PyFoamApplication.__getitem__>, 'addLocalConfig': <function PyFoamApplication.addLocalConfig>})¶
__getattr__(key)[source]¶
__getitem__(key)[source]¶

Get application data

__init__(args=None, description=None, epilog=None, examples=None, usage=None, interspersed=False, nr=None, changeVersion=True, exactNr=True, subcommands=None, inputApp=None, localConfigurationFile=None, findLocalConfigurationFile=None, **kwArgs)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • description – description of the command
  • epilog – text to be printed after the options-help
  • examples – usage examples to be printed after the epilog
  • usage – Usage
  • interspersed – Is the command line allowed to be interspersed (options after the arguments)
  • args – Command line arguments when using the Application as a ‘class’ from a script
  • nr – Number of required arguments
  • changeVersion – May this application change the version of OF used?
  • exactNr – Must not have more than the required number of arguments
  • subcommands – parse and use subcommands from the command line. Either True or a list with subcommands
  • inputApp – Application with input data. Used to allow a ‘pipe-like’ behaviour if the class is used from a Script
  • localConfigurationFile – Use this file (or list of files) as a local configuration
  • findLocalConfigurationFile – Method to find a configuration file BEFORE the actual parameters are parsed

Iterate over the application data

Add options to the parser

addToCaseLog(name, *text)[source]¶

Add information about the application that was run to the case-log

checkCase(name, fatal=True, verbose=True)[source]¶

Check whether this is a valid OpenFOAM-case :param name: the directory-bame that is supposed to be the case :param fatal: If this is not a case then the application ends :param verbose: If this is not a case no warning is issued

PyFoamApplication.iteritems()[source]¶
PyFoamApplication.iterkeys()[source]¶
PyFoamApplication.localConfigFromCasename(args)[source]¶

Look for the local configuration assuming that the first argument after ‘-case’ is the case directory

PyFoamApplication.localConfigInArgs(args)[source]¶

Assume that the first argument that is no option and a directory can have a local configuration

PyFoamApplication.localConfigInArgsFile(args)[source]¶

Assume that the first argument that is no option and a file can has a local configuration in the same directory

PyFoamApplication.localConfigInCWD(args)[source]¶

find the local configuration in the current directory

PyFoamApplication.run()[source]¶

Run the real application

PyFoamApplication.setData(data)[source]¶

Set the application data

Parameters:data – dictionary whose entries will be added to the

application data (possibly overwriting old entries of the same name)

PyFoamApplication.silent(*args)[source]¶

Don’t print a warning message :param args: Arguments that are to be printed

PyFoamApplication.warning(*args)[source]¶

Prints a warning message :param args: Arguments that are to be printed
